OrganizationObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

OrganizationObjectID.type: WID,  Company_Reference_ID,  Cost_Center_Reference_ID,  Custom_Organization_Reference_ID,  Organization_Reference_ID,  Region_Reference_ID
OrganizationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

OrganizationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Submit_Mass_Update_Ledger_Period_Status_.description: Indicates the Period Close Activity Group for Close in Progress Period Status.

description: Element containing data necessary for submitting update ledger period status

validation.validation: Enter a valid status for the period. Valid statuses are: [validStatuses].
You cannot change the status of the ledger period for a closed ledger year. Open the ledger year before changing the status of the ledger periods.
You can't enter a value for more than one of these fields: All Book Codes, Blank Book Code, Book Code.
You must enter a value for one of these fields: All Book Codes, Blank Book Code, Book Code.
The status for period [period] is Close in Progress. Closed Activity must be entered.
You can only select Closed Activity when the status is Close in Progress.

Ledger year and ledger periods are not created for one or more of the selected companies. You must create a ledger year and ledger periods for these companies before selecting the Fiscal Year and Fiscal Posting Interval.
The fiscal schedule entered doesn't match the fiscal schedule of the company. Enter a different fiscal schedule before you change the status of the ledger period.
